title: Introduction to Coordinate Plane and Graphing

vocab.definition: A flat surface with two perpendicular number lines used to locate points
The horizontal number line on a coordinate plane
The vertical number line on a coordinate plane
A pair of numbers (x, y) that shows the location of a point on a coordinate plane
The point (0, 0) where the x-axis and y-axis meet
One of the four sections of the coordinate plane divided by the x- and y-axes

teachingNotes: Start with simple positive coordinates. Teach that the first number goes right/left and the second number goes up/down. Practice plotting points and reading coordinates.

sample.question: What ordered pair represents the origin?
In (x, y), which coordinate tells you how far to move up or down?
The point (0, 5) is on which axis?
What ordered pair is 6 right and 3 up?
The point (7, 0) lies on the ________ axis.
A point at (2, 2) is in which quadrant when only positive axes are used?

truefalse.question: In the ordered pair (3, 5), the 3 tells you to move 3 units to the right.
The first number in (x, y) tells left-right movement.
The point (0, 4) lies on the x-axis.
The point (5, 0) lies on the y-axis.
A point at (7, 0) is on the x-axis.
The origin is where the axes meet.

multiplechoice.question: What are the coordinates 3 right and 4 up?
Which point is on the y-axis?
Which point is on the x-axis?
Which point is 1 left and 2 up from (3, 2)?
Which ordered pair represents 2 right and 0 up?
If a point moves from (1, 2) to (1, 5), what changed?
Which point is 0 right and 7 up?
Which point lies at the origin?

fillintheblank.question: To plot the point (4, 2), move 4 units right and ________ units up.
In (x, y), the first number is the ________-coordinate.
The vertical axis is the ________ axis.
A point on the x-axis has a ________ value of 0.
A point on the y-axis has an ________ value of 0.

shortanswer.question: What are the coordinates of a point that is 3 units right and 1 unit up from the origin?
Describe the difference between x and y coordinates.
expectedAny: x is horizontal; y is vertical
x is side to side; y is up and down

shortanswer.question: Give a real-life example of using a coordinate plane.
What point is 4 left and 2 up from (3, 3)?
How can you tell if a point is on an axis?
expectedAny: x is zero or y is zero

shortanswer.question: Give the coordinates of a point 0 right and 0 up.
Explain why (2, 3) ≠ (3, 2).
expectedAny: switching the numbers changes the point

wordProblems.question: On a treasure map, the treasure is located at coordinates (5, 4). If you start at the origin, how do you get there?
A point marks a tree at (7, 1). Starting from (2, 1), how do you reach the tree?
A robot starts at (0, 0). It moves to (3, 2), then to (3, 5). What changed between the last two points?
On a grid, a house is at (4, 0). Is it on an axis? Which one?
A playground is at (0, 6). Is it on an axis? Which one?
Starting at (2, 3), how do you get to (5, 3)?
A store is at (6, 4). From (6, 1), how do you get there?
A map uses a grid. A park is at (0, 0). Where is it?
